newsitem.title: LATVIA: UNIBANKA SAYS STILL WANTS TO BE BIGGEST BANK.
newsitem.headline: UNIBANKA SAYS STILL WANTS TO BE BIGGEST BANK.

text.p: Unibanka said on Tuesday that it still wanted to be the largest bank in the country depsite the cancellation of its merger with eighth largest bank, Zemes Banka.
The two banks earlier took the banking market by surprise by calling off their merger after several months of talks.
"We have been working and we will work towards increasing our market share. Our plans have not become less aggressive," Unibanka president Andris Berzinsh told a news conference.
"Our strategy is to be one of the biggest banks in Latvia," he added.
Asked whether Unibanka was considering a merger with another bank, Berzinsh said that this was a commercial secret.
"We are adjusting our strategy to the changing conditions and I do not rule out any possibility," he told Reuters.
Unibanka is currently the second largest bank in terms of assets after privately-owned Parex Bank.
